sense.gloss: to follow (a road, path, etc.), to trace
to follow (a clue, scent, tracks, plot, etc.), to trace (a route, history, family tree, etc.), to retrace (e.g. one's memory), to search, to go over
to head towards (of a situation), to go in the direction of, to take (a course), to pursue (a path), to meet (a fate)

sdata.j: ヘーゲルと↑同様↑↓どうよう↓に、パノフスキーの↑弁論↑↓べんろん↓↑方↑↓かた↓の↑概念↑↓がいねん↓は↑歴史↑↓れきし↓があらかじめ↑定↑↓さだ↓められた↑道程↑↓どうてい↓を|たどる|ようにさせている。
sdata.e: In the same way as Hegel, Panovsky's notion of the dialectic makes history follow a predetermined course.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑票決↑↓ひょうけつ↓↑記録↑↓きろく↓を|たどる|と↑矛盾↑↓むじゅん↓だらけです。
sdata.e: His voting record is riddled with contradictions.

sdata.j: その↑電話↑↓でんわ↓は↑南↑↓みなみ↓デトロイトからであると↑辿↑↓|たど↓る|ことができた。
sdata.e: The call was traceable to an address in south Detroit.

sdata.j: ↑失業↑↓しつぎょう↓↑率↑↓りつ↓が↑上昇↑↓じょうしょう↓の↑一途↑↓いっと↓を|たどる|↑昨今↑↓さっこん↓の↑景気↑↓けいき↓↑動向↑↓どうこう↓を↑勘案↑↓かんあん↓して、↑政府↑↓せいふ↓は↑追加↑↓ついか↓の↑経済↑↓けいざい↓↑対策↑↓たいさく↓を↑打↑↓う↓ち↑出↑↓だ↓した。
sdata.e: Taking into account the continued steady rise of unemployment in the current economic climate, the government issued some new economic measures.
